place.name: LITTLE BARDFIELD
place.gazetteerText: BARDFIELD (Little), a parish in Dunmow district, Essex: on Blackwater river, 11 miles NW of Braintree r. station. It has a post office under Braintree. Acres, 1,710. Real property, £3, 082. Pop., 429. Houses, 90. The property is much subdivided. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Rochester. Value, £590.* Patron, the Rev. M. Barnard. The church is good. Alms-houses and other charities have £89. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
